primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The journey of faith from safe, controlled places toward a new neighborhood of shalom, sustained by a reliable Guardian.

tekstueel_bewijs: We are on the road again
we... must also travel beyond safe places
we are left to decide to stay or to go

object.identificatie: Generative Newness / The Neighborhood of Shalom
tekstueel_bewijs: moving into the generative newness given by God

zender.identificatie: The God of all travel / The Self-Starter
tekstueel_bewijs: the God who calls into existence the things that do not exist
to be a blessing to the others around them
love the neighbor whom we have seen
My help comes from the LORD
world of privilege, entitlement, power, and wealth
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is primarily the socio-economic status quo and the psychological 'stubborn refusal' of the hearer.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God's own journey to Jerusalem and the cross to provide for the world.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: God/Jesus
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: God's performance (Easter) provides the 'traveling mercies' that enable the human journey.

voorbeelden_mens_subject: We are on the road again

voorbeelden: Nicodemus does not want to go
awareness that our conventional way of life
we may journey to a new self
we may consider where we are summoned

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the recruitment of the will (Willingness vs. Refusal).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From the safety of S2, through the failure of ~S1 (Nicodemus), toward the risk of S1, supported by ~S2.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God's character as 'Keeper' who makes the risky journey possible.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; staying is equated with death and 'anti-neighborliness'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While God is the source of power, the narrative engine is driven by the human decision to 'go' or 'stay'.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: if we linger... we drop out of the narrative
we are left to decide to stay or to go

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: This God is the only self-starter
we will receive gestures of that self-giving God

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Abraham is the model of willingness; Nicodemus is the model of refusal.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Focus on God who calls Abraham out of nothingness, rather than Abraham's trust as the catalyst.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to choose correctly; anxiety regarding 'dropping out'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Synergism: God provides the road and the protection, but the human must walk it to remain in the narrative.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The ethical program (justice/neighborliness) is well-integrated as the destination of the journey.
spanning_punten: God as 'only self-starter' vs. 'we are left to decide'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a 'Recruitment' narrative. It uses God as a Helper to facilitate a Human Subject's journey.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is the one who must 'move' to stay in God's story.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make God the Subject who 'carries' or 'moves' the traveler.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'we must travel,' use 'The God who called Abraham now carries us beyond our safe places.'

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as the 'decider' between life and death.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize that we are the 'Object' of God's keeping before we are the 'Subject' of the walking.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus more on how the 'Self-giving God' creates the ability to leave privilege.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Frame the 'old self' as a dead end that only a resurrection (not just a journey) can fix.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: To move from moral improvement to radical grace.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: The hierarchy of 'Gift then Task' is present but the 'Task' dominates the verbs.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has a strong prophetic edge and beautiful imagery, but risks turning the Gospel into a 'summons to travel' rather than 'news of a rescue'.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the 'we' creates community; actantially, it places the burden of the narrative on the congregation.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis shows Psalm 121 is about God's protection; Greimas shows the sermon uses that protection to fuel a human ethical journey.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that Nicodemus is cast as a 'failed subject' which creates a conditional soteriology.

appendices.notities: The sermon leans heavily on the 'Journey' metaphor which naturally privileges human agency.
